sections.title: IN CONCLUSION
sections.content:
## IN CONCLUSION

The Shoulder Formula is JUST the Beginning… You’ve taken the first step which is more than 99% of people Picture this: You’ve poured sweat & genuine effort into countless workouts. Experimenting with every diet, yet your dream physique feels just out of reach. Sound familiar? You’re not alone.

This is for you IF:

You’ve been grinding for months (or even years) and still haven’t reached your goals. Progress feels like a cruel joke...that plateau has become your worst enemy. Your fitness journey is a never-ending cycle, getting close to your goal only to slide back. You fuel your body like a champion but can’t seem to pack on muscle. It’s infuriating, isn’t it?

If any of this resonates,  LISTEN CLOSELY.

Information is powerful, but information alone won’t transform you.  You need something clear & direct with little to NO CHANCE of FAILURE.

That’s why I’m here to offer you  The Full Formula

A proven system that has changed lives for men no different than you.

Men who have:

Suffered through endless bulking and cutting cycles. Obsessed over calorie counts and macros. Fought through countless workouts without seeing the results they craved.

This is ONLY for those who are fed up and ready to reclaim their natural dominance.  If getting jacked and ripped is merely “take it or leave it” for you, this isn’t for you.

I’ve dedicated over a decade to mastering the art and science of transformation. You don’t have to endure the emotional rollercoaster I did.

I can promise you results in a fraction of the time.

**[⇒   CLICK HERE To Become Undeniable](https://superhuman.nattymaxx.com/uncle-rommy1731440009352)**

When they say it’s ‘too good to be natural,’ wear it like a crown But let’s get real for a moment. If you choose to ignore this opportunity today, what happens?

You’ll find yourself exactly where you are now, one year from today. You’ll look in the mirror and think, “How did I end up in the same shape after another year of trying?” You’ll fall back into that self-sabotaging loop, questioning your worth and capabilities.

That’s one potential future.

Fortunately, there’s another path...one that’s bright and EASY to understand. On this path, you:

Achieve the physique of your dreams. Strong, ripped, and confident with your presence commanding respect. Accelerate increases in muscle and strength, fueling energy and overall drive (Winning gives you energy...Losing takes it away) Finally HAVE the goals you’ve chased for years. Standing taller with people in the world finally noticing you.

The version of you that you’ve always wanted does exist & it’s on the other side of 6-12 months of focused, deliberate effort.

If you genuinely want this, stop getting in your own way. Transform into the man you know you can be.

**[⇒   CLICK HERE To Become Undeniable](https://superhuman.nattymaxx.com/uncle-rommy1731440009352)**

When they ask if you’re natural, that’s when you know you’ve arrived.

Both paths require effort.

I know this firsthand. I’ve been at war with my body, and I’ve also been the jacked, fulfilled version of myself.

Now it’s your turn.  Bet on Yourself , and I guarantee that next year, you’ll look in the mirror and see an unstoppable force.

**[⇒   CLICK HERE To Become Undeniable](https://superhuman.nattymaxx.com/uncle-rommy1731440009352)**

Real strength invites skepticism. Are you ready to be the one they can’t ignore?

BECOME UNDENIABLE This is for men who want to be so strong, so impactful, so real that they’re simply undeniable.

Every man has a choice: to be undeniable or to be invisible.

This world wasn’t made for men who settle.

If you’ve always felt like the outlier, the one with more to give, now it’s time to show the world why.

**[⇒   CLICK HERE To Become Undeniable](https://superhuman.nattymaxx.com/uncle-rommy1731440009352)**

## THANK YOU FOR READING!

exercises.name: Active Hangs
exercises.cueSummary: Same hang but actively pull shoulder blades down and in; hold with control to build scapular stability.

exercises.name: Arnold Press
exercises.cueSummary: Start palms facing you, elbows in; rotate and press up so palms face forward at the top to hit all three heads of the delt.

exercises.name: Back Bridges
exercises.cueSummary: Full body bridge on hands and feet, chest high, to open shoulders and strengthen the entire posterior chain.

exercises.name: Backward Walking on the Treadmill
exercises.cueSummary: Walk slowly backward on a slight incline, staying tall and letting quads and shins handle the deceleration.

exercises.name: Banded DECLINE Dumbbell Presses
exercises.cueSummary: Decline dumbbell press with band resistance.

exercises.name: Banded FLAT Dumbbell Presses
exercises.cueSummary: Flat dumbbell press with band resistance for accommodating resistance.

exercises.name: Banded INCLINE Dumbbell Presses
exercises.cueSummary: Incline dumbbell press with band resistance for increased tension at lockout.

exercises.name: Barbell/EZ Bar Curl
exercises.cueSummary: Stand tall, no swinging, curl from a full stretch to a hard squeeze.

exercises.name: Barbell/EZ Bar Pullovers
exercises.cueSummary: On a bench, lower bar behind head for a big lat stretch then pull over using lats, not triceps.

exercises.name: Barbell Good Mornings
exercises.cueSummary: Classic hip hinge with bar on back – slow, controlled, with a strong brace.

exercises.name: Barbell Hip Thrusts
exercises.cueSummary: Upper back on bench, shins vertical at the top, drive hips up and squeeze glutes hard with a brief pause each rep.

exercises.name: Barbell Split Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Set up in a long split stance, drop back knee toward the floor and drive up through the front leg.

exercises.name: Behind the Ankle Barbell Raise
exercises.cueSummary: Hold the bar behind your ankles and raise it slightly by squeezing rear delts and upper back – tiny ROM, huge burn.

exercises.name: Behind the Arse Bar Raise
exercises.cueSummary: Bar held behind the glutes, slight hinge and raise to hit rear delts and upper traps together.

exercises.name: Behind the Arse Cable Upright Rows (Straight Bar Attachment)
exercises.cueSummary: Cable upright rows performed behind the body, keeping elbows high to light up mid delts and traps with continuous tension.

exercises.name: Behind the Arse Upright Rows (Straight Bar / EZ Bar)
exercises.cueSummary: Perform upright rows with the bar behind the body to change the line of pull and hammer side delts and traps.

exercises.name: Behind Ass Lateral Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Start dumbbells slightly behind the hips and sweep out to the side to bias the mid‑delt through a different angle.

exercises.name: Behind Neck Press
exercises.cueSummary: Carefully lower the bar behind the head with control and press back up, staying in a comfortable, pain‑free range.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Back foot on a bench, sink into the front leg and keep torso slightly forward, pushing through the mid‑foot.

exercises.name: Cable Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Keep constant tension with the cable, squeeze at the top.

exercises.name: Cable Good Mornings
exercises.cueSummary: Back to cable stack, rope behind neck or shoulders, hinge and extend with constant tension.

exercises.name: Cable Hamstring Curls
exercises.cueSummary: With an ankle strap on a low cable, curl your heel toward your glute under full control, one leg at a time.

exercises.name: Cable Handle External Rotations
exercises.cueSummary: Elbow pinned, rotate forearm away from body with cable resistance, slow and controlled.

exercises.name: Cable Handle Internal Rotations
exercises.cueSummary: Elbow pinned, rotate forearm toward body to hit internal rotators and front of the cuff.

exercises.name: Cable Upper Chest Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Set cables low, fly upward to target upper chest fibers.

exercises.name: Chest Dips
exercises.cueSummary: Lean forward, flare elbows slightly, dip deep for lower chest emphasis.

exercises.name: Chest Supported Lateral Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Lean chest‑down on an incline bench and perform lateral raises to remove body english and torch side delts.

exercises.name: Chest Supported Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Lay on an incline bench, let the arms hang and row with zero lower‑back cheating.

exercises.name: Chest Supported Shrugs
exercises.cueSummary: Chest on bench, shrug straight up and slightly back, hold the top to crush traps without wrecking your neck.

exercises.name: Close Grip Bar Curl
exercises.cueSummary: Use a closer grip to bias long head and keep elbows fixed at your sides.

exercises.name: Close Grip Bench Press
exercises.cueSummary: Grip just inside shoulder width, tuck elbows, drive up with triceps.

exercises.name: Close Grip Pull-Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Closer grip, think “drive elbows down in front of you” to emphasize lower lats and teres.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Planks
exercises.cueSummary: Top leg on a bench, body in a side‑plank line, squeeze inner thigh to hold position and own the burn.

exercises.name: Cossack Barbell Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Barbell version of Cossack squats – step wide, shift side to side into deep single-leg positions while the bar stays centered over your base.

exercises.name: Cossack Dumbbell Squat
exercises.cueSummary: Step wide, sit deeply over one heel while keeping the other leg straight, chest tall and heel rooted.

exercises.name: Criss Cross Cable Pushdowns
exercises.cueSummary: Cross cables and press down, focusing on peak contraction in the outer head.

exercises.name: Criss Cross Cable Pushdowns
exercises.cueSummary: Cables set in a crossover, driving down and out for a brutal lateral‑head pump.

exercises.name: DB RDLs
exercises.cueSummary: With dumbbells in hand, push hips back and keep the bells close to your thighs, then drive up with hamstrings and glutes.

exercises.name: Dead Hangs
exercises.cueSummary: Hang from a bar for time to build grip resilience and shoulder traction.

exercises.name: Dead Hangs
exercises.cueSummary: Hang from a bar for time; relax into the stretch and let the shoulders decompress.

exercises.name: Deadlifts
exercises.cueSummary: Classic hinge from the hips, neutral spine, stand tall with the bar – King of erector loading.

exercises.name: Dead Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Rowing from a dead‑stop each rep – bar comes to the floor or blocks, kill momentum and re‑pull every time.

exercises.name: Decline Cable Crossovers
exercises.cueSummary: Set cables high, bring handles down and across for lower chest.

exercises.name: Decline Dumbbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Decline bench angle, press dumbbells up following lower chest fiber direction.

exercises.name: Deficit Deadlifts
exercises.cueSummary: Stand on a small plate or block, push hips back, keep shins close to the bar and pull from a deeper starting position.

exercises.name: Dips
exercises.cueSummary: Lean slightly forward or stay upright depending on emphasis; hit full lockout.

exercises.name: Dog Pounds
exercises.cueSummary: Cable movement for lower chest isolation, bring handles down forcefully.

exercises.name: Double Arm Hammer Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Both arms hammer‑curling together for a heavy brachialis and forearm hit.

exercises.name: Double Hammer Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Neutral grip dumbbell curls with both arms to hammer brachialis and brachioradialis.

exercises.name: Double Hammer Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Neutral‑grip curls with both arms moving together to blow up brachialis and forearms.

exercises.name: Double Trouble
exercises.cueSummary: Brutal shoulder finisher combining two delt-destroying movements back-to-back to push past failure.

exercises.name: Drag Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Drag the bar up your torso, keeping elbows back to emphasize long head and brachialis.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Deadlifts
exercises.cueSummary: Hold dumbbells at your sides or in front, hinge back and stand tall like a deadlift with a slightly friendlier setup than a barbell.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Forearm Circuit
exercises.cueSummary: Series of dumbbell forearm moves strung together to build grip and elbow resilience.

exercises.name: Dumbbell JM Press
exercises.cueSummary: Dumbbell version of JM press; elbows tucked, lower toward face and extend without losing tension.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Kickbacks
exercises.cueSummary: Hinge over, upper arm fixed, extend the dumbbell back and squeeze at lockout.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullovers
exercises.cueSummary: Lie across bench, lower dumbbell behind head with slight elbow bend, pull back over.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotations
exercises.cueSummary: Elbow pinned to your side, rotate the forearm outward with a light dumbbell to hammer the external rotators without cranking the shoulder.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Tricep Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Overhead or lying, extend the dumbbells and squeeze the triceps at the top.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Tricep Lying Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Lying on a bench, lower dumbbells behind head for a stretch and extend to full lockout.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Tricep Lying Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Classic dumbbell skull‑crusher style — lower behind the head for a deep stretch, then extend.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Tricep Lying Extensions (with Twist)
exercises.cueSummary: Same as lying extensions but finish with a twist to squeeze every fiber of the long head.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Tricep Lying Extensions with Twist
exercises.cueSummary: Same as lying extensions but twist at the top for extra squeeze in the tricep.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.cueSummary: Pull to eye level, thumbs back, elbows high – “pull the rope apart” to smash rear delts and upper back.

exercises.name: Face Pulls (Back-Focused)
exercises.cueSummary: Pull rope to forehead/eye level, thumbs back, elbows high and wide – drive from rear delts and upper back, not biceps.

exercises.name: Farmer Carries + Shrugs
exercises.cueSummary: Heavy carries with integrated shrugs to train grip, traps and overall arm support.

exercises.name: Feet Elevated Plate Push-Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Feet elevated with hands on weight plates for extra ROM and upper chest emphasis.

exercises.name: Feet Elevated Push-Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Elevate feet on bench or box, perform push-ups to emphasize upper chest.

exercises.name: Flat Barbell Bench
exercises.cueSummary: Classic flat bench press, lower to mid-chest and press up.

exercises.name: Flat Cable Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Cables at chest height, fly and squeeze at the center.

exercises.name: Flat Dumbbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Flat bench, press dumbbells up and slightly inward following mid chest fibers.

exercises.name: Flat Plate Push-Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Hands on weight plates for extra depth and ROM.

exercises.name: Flat Press Hammer Strength
exercises.cueSummary: Hammer Strength flat press machine for controlled mid-chest work.

exercises.name: Floor Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Dumbbell flyes on the floor - floor limits ROM to protect shoulders.

exercises.name: Floor Press
exercises.cueSummary: Barbell press from the floor - limited ROM protects rotator cuff.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Forearm Circuit
exercises.cueSummary: Forearm circuit with dumbbells to blow up grip, pump and endurance.

exercises.name: Sledgehammer Forearm Sequence
exercises.cueSummary: Sledgehammer swings/lever work to build insane forearm density and grip.

exercises.name: Front Cable Raises
exercises.cueSummary: With a cable attachment set low, raise straight in front of you, keeping constant tension on the front delts.

exercises.name: Front Dumbbell Raises (Incline)
exercises.cueSummary: Lying back on an incline bench, raise dumbbells in front of you with straight arms to bias front delts with stability.

exercises.name: Front Dumbbell Raises (Seated)
exercises.cueSummary: Seated to remove leg drive, raise dumbbells straight in front of you with a slight elbow bend and focus on front‑delt tension.

exercises.name: Front Dumbbell Raises (Standing)
exercises.cueSummary: Stand tall and raise dumbbells in front of you to about eye level, controlling the negative and not swinging.

exercises.name: Front Dumbbell Raises to the Sky
exercises.cueSummary: Long‑range front raise variation driving the bells up and slightly in, focusing on a strong squeeze at the top.

exercises.name: Front Plate Raise
exercises.cueSummary: Hold a plate at the bottom, raise it to eye or forehead level, keeping arms slightly bent and core braced.

exercises.name: Front Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Bar on the front rack, elbows high, full depth with knees tracking over toes, pause at the bottom then drive up.

exercises.name: Full Body Mobility Movement
exercises.cueSummary: Full‑body flow including deep squats, thoracic rotations and reaches to unlock the chain from hips to shoulders.

exercises.name: Full ROM Back Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Bar on the upper back, brace hard and sit into a controlled full‑depth squat before driving back up.

exercises.name: Glute Bridge (Feet Elevated)
exercises.cueSummary: Feet on a bench or box, drive hips up by squeezing hamstrings and glutes, control the eccentric down.

exercises.name: Hammer Strength Shoulder Press
exercises.cueSummary: Machine shoulder press variation to hammer the delts with stability – lock in and drive hard through the handles.

exercises.name: Hammer Strength Tricep Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Use the Hammer Strength plate-loaded tricep machine, drive through full ROM with strong lockout.

exercises.name: Hammer Strength Tricep Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Machine‑based heavy extensions where you can safely load the long head.

exercises.name: Handstand Holds
exercises.cueSummary: Supported or freestanding handstand holds to load shoulders in a stacked overhead position.

exercises.name: Handstand Push-Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Advanced bodyweight shoulder press – kick up into handstand and perform push-ups for serious overhead strength.

exercises.name: Heel Elevated Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Elevate your heels on plates, stay upright and sit knees forward over toes to bias quads and VMO.

exercises.name: High Elbow Cable Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Row with elbows high and wide to slam rear delts and upper back; think about driving elbows back, not hands.

exercises.name: High Elbow Hammer Strength Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Chest braced on the Hammer Strength machine, row with elbows flared high toward the chest to bias upper‑back thickness over lats.

exercises.name: High Elbow Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Barbell rows pulled higher toward the chest with flared elbows to light up the upper back rather than the lower lats.

exercises.name: High to Low Cable Rows
exercises.cueSummary: From a high pulley, row the handle down and back toward the hip following a high‑to‑low path to smoke the lower lats.

exercises.name: Hindu Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Bodyweight squats with heels up, big knee travel and a flowing rhythm to pump quads and calves.

exercises.name: Hip Abduction Machine
exercises.cueSummary: Push knees out against the pads, keeping the pelvis still and focusing on side‑hip contraction.

exercises.name: Hip Adduction Machine
exercises.cueSummary: Drive knees together against the pads, hold a squeeze and control the eccentric to hammer the groin safely.

exercises.name: Hip Huggers
exercises.cueSummary: Drag the weight up along the sides of your body, “hugging” your hips and driving elbows back to light up rear delts.

exercises.name: Hyperextension Rows
exercises.cueSummary: On hyperextension bench, hold weight and row at the top of the back‑extension – nasty combo of erectors and mid‑back.

exercises.name: Incline Barbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Incline bench at 30-45 degrees, lower to upper chest, press following fiber direction.

exercises.name: Incline Close Grip Bench Press
exercises.cueSummary: Use a closer grip on an incline bench to load upper chest and triceps.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Sit back on an incline, let arms hang, curl without swinging, stretch the long head.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Power Bombs
exercises.cueSummary: On an incline bench, use a deep stretch and powerful extension to “power bomb” the triceps.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Power Bombs
exercises.cueSummary: Big range‑of‑motion tricep extensions on an incline bench – long head stretch plus power.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Set bench to 30-45 degrees, press up following the muscle fibers of the upper chest.

exercises.name: Incline Press Hammer Strength
exercises.cueSummary: Machine incline press, focus on squeezing upper chest at the top.

exercises.name: Inverted Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Set a bar in a rack, position yourself underneath, then drive chest up and pull the shoulder blades back to raise the torso and crush the traps.

exercises.name: JM Press
exercises.cueSummary: Hybrid between close-grip bench and skull crusher; lower toward face and press back up, loading triceps heavily.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Toe Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Hold a kettlebell over your toes and repeatedly pull the front of your foot up toward your shin.

exercises.name: Landmine Chest Press
exercises.cueSummary: Press the landmine attachment upward and inward for upper chest activation.

exercises.name: Lateral Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Classic side raise – slight elbow bend, raise dumbbells out to the side no higher than shoulder level, leading with elbows.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldowns
exercises.cueSummary: Sit tight, pull bar to upper chest, keep chest tall and lats tight. No half‑rep ego pulldowns.

exercises.name: Lat Pull Ins
exercises.cueSummary: Side‑leaned cable pulldown where you drive elbow into the hip – full stretch and brutal lat contraction.

exercises.name: Leg Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Lock your hips down, curl the pad toward your glutes with control and squeeze at the top before lowering slowly.

exercises.name: Leg Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Lock hips down, extend knees fully with control, hold the top squeeze before lowering under tension.

exercises.name: Leg Press Machine
exercises.cueSummary: Feet on platform, control the lowering to deep flexion then drive the sled away without locking knees violently.

exercises.name: LU Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Rear‑delt/cuff raise variant where you trace a “U” path, keeping tension on the shoulder the entire time.

exercises.name: Mid Delt Drop Set
exercises.cueSummary: Run successive weight drops on lateral raises with minimal rest to push the mid delts well past failure.

exercises.name: Mobility Wall Routine
exercises.cueSummary: Wall‑based shoulder and scap drills (slides, reaches, rotations) to open posture and restore overhead and behind‑the‑back range.

exercises.name: Modified Bradford Press
exercises.cueSummary: Press the bar just over the top of the head, moving it from in front to behind the head without fully locking out, keeping constant tension on the delts.

exercises.name: Neck Bridges
exercises.cueSummary: Careful, controlled bridging on head/neck to build neck and trap resilience.

exercises.name: Neutral Grip Barbell Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Neutral grip attachment on a bar or machine; pull toward mid‑torso with torso locked in place.

exercises.name: Neutral Grip Dumbbell Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Classic one‑arm DB row with a neutral grip – pull elbow back toward hip, no twisting.

exercises.name: Neutral Grip Hammer Strength Row
exercises.cueSummary: Neutral‑handle Hammer Strength rows pulling toward mid‑torso with a locked‑in torso for big lats and mid‑back thickness.

exercises.name: Neutral Grip Pulldown
exercises.cueSummary: Neutral handle to keep shoulders comfortable while still hammering lats; think “squeeze armpits” at the bottom.

exercises.name: Nordic Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Anchor your heels, lower your body under control like a falling plank, then push off the floor as needed to return.

exercises.name: Overhead Barbell Press Holds
exercises.cueSummary: Lock a barbell overhead and hold – stack ribs over hips, keep scapula elevated and stable.

exercises.name: Overhead Squat / Snatch Holds
exercises.cueSummary: Wide‑grip overhead squat or snatch catch positions held for time to challenge thoracic extension and scapular control.

exercises.name: Pec Dec Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Use pec deck machine, squeeze hard at the center.

exercises.name: Pistol Squats
exercises.cueSummary: On one leg, sit as low as control allows while the other leg stays in front, then stand without collapsing inward.

exercises.name: Powell Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Side‑lying rear‑delt raise focused on external rotation and posterior shoulder activation.

exercises.name: Preacher Bar Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Similar to machine but with free weight; control the bottom stretch.

exercises.name: Preacher Curl Machine
exercises.cueSummary: Let the pad lock your upper arm, curl through a full ROM.

exercises.name: Preacher Machine Hammer Curl
exercises.cueSummary: Hammer-grip preacher machine curl to lock in position and torch brachialis.

exercises.name: Push-Up Circuit
exercises.cueSummary: Multiple push-up variations strung together for complete chest activation.

exercises.name: Push-Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Classic push-up, hands shoulder width, full ROM.

exercises.name: PVC Pipe Shoulder Sequence
exercises.cueSummary: Pass‑throughs, around‑the‑worlds and wall‑slide style drills done with PVC to open shoulders.

exercises.name: Rack Pulls
exercises.cueSummary: Partial deadlift from pins or blocks to overload erectors and upper‑back without full ROM stress.

exercises.name: Regular Lat Pulldowns
exercises.cueSummary: Standard pulldown variation used as a go‑to for both lats and teres minor stimulation.

exercises.name: Regular Pull Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Shoulder‑width grip, full range of motion, no kipping – crisp reps building base vertical pulling strength.

exercises.name: Reverse Barbell Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Pronated grip bar curls to smash brachialis and forearms.

exercises.name: Reverse Barbell Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Pronated‑grip curls with a barbell to hammer the brachialis and brachioradialis.

exercises.name: Reverse Barbell/EZ Bar Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Reverse curls with a barbell or EZ bar; slight angle can be easier on the wrists.

exercises.name: Reverse Dumbbell Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Use a pronated grip, curl without swinging to blow up brachialis and forearms.

exercises.name: Reverse Grip Barbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Use a supinated grip to bias upper chest and front delts; keep wrists straight and control the bar path.

exercises.name: Reverse Grip Bench
exercises.cueSummary: Underhand grip bench press - externally rotates shoulders to protect rotator cuff.

exercises.name: Reverse Grip Pushdowns
exercises.cueSummary: Underhand grip, elbows pinned, extend and lock out under control.

exercises.name: Reverse Hyperextensions
exercises.cueSummary: Lift legs behind you on reverse hyper to train low back with more hip contribution and less spinal compression.

exercises.name: Reverse Incline Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Lay chest‑down on an incline bench and sweep the dumbbells out wide, driving from the shoulder blades.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunges
exercises.cueSummary: Step back into a lunge, keep front knee over mid‑foot and drive through the front heel to stand.

exercises.name: Reverse Nordics
exercises.cueSummary: Kneel tall, squeeze glutes and slowly lean back keeping a straight line from knees to shoulders, then return.

exercises.name: Reverse Pec Dec Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Chest on the pad, pull the handles out and back in a wide arc, squeezing rear delts hard.

exercises.name: Reverse Plate Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Hold a plate with a pronated grip and curl, keeping wrists strong.

exercises.name: Reverse Plate Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Hold a plate with both hands and curl using a pronated grip for forearm and brachialis burn.

exercises.name: Reverse Squats
exercises.cueSummary: With a belt or strap around your hips on a low cable, sit back and let the weight pull you into flexion, then drive hips through.

exercises.name: Ring Around The Rommy’s
exercises.cueSummary: Ring‑based shoulder and scapular circles to open up the entire shoulder girdle.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.cueSummary: Soft knees, slide the bar down your thighs while pushing hips back, feel the stretch, then snap hips forward.

exercises.name: Rope Attachment Tricep Superset
exercises.cueSummary: Use rope, spread at the bottom and lock out hard to torch the outer head.

exercises.name: Rope Attachment Upright Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Cable upright rows with a rope, pulling elbows high while keeping shoulders down to torch traps without jamming the shoulders.

exercises.name: Seated Barbell Good Mornings
exercises.cueSummary: Seated on a bench with bar on back, hinge forward under control and extend to light up erectors.

exercises.name: Seated Barbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Similar to standing press but seated; push the bar overhead without letting the lower back arch off the bench.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Sit tall, chest up, row to the lower ribs while squeezing the shoulder blades together.

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Good Mornings
exercises.cueSummary: Seated version with dumbbells – hinge forward keeping spine controlled, then extend.

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Seated with back supported, press dumbbells overhead in a slight arc while keeping wrists stacked and elbows under the bells.

exercises.name: Seated Reverse Incline Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Seated with chest on pad, perform reverse flyes to isolate upper‑back fibers and rear delts.

exercises.name: 21’s (Shoulder)
exercises.cueSummary: Partial‑range reps broken into segments (bottom/mid/top) to rack up 21 total reps and annihilate the delts.

exercises.name: Shoulder Elixir Potion
exercises.cueSummary: Rommy’s shoulder potion – a sequence tying together hangs, rotations and pulls to restore shoulder function.

exercises.name: Side‑Lying Leg Lift
exercises.cueSummary: Lying on your side, raise the top leg in line with your body, toes slightly down, and squeeze the side hip.

exercises.name: Side-Lying Leg Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Side‑lying hip/leg abduction that shows up in the rehab bank as hip stability work to support low‑back function.

exercises.name: Single Arm Brachialis Cable Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Cable single-arm curl with neutral/hammer grip to bias brachialis hard.

exercises.name: Single Arm Brachialis Cable Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Cable anchored low, neutral or slightly pronated grip, curling only at the elbow.

exercises.name: Single Arm Cable Row
exercises.cueSummary: Single‑arm cable rows with a big stretch at the front, then driving the elbow back toward the hip while the torso stays braced.

exercises.name: Single Arm DB Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Overhead or lying, extend fully and squeeze the back of the arm.

exercises.name: Single Arm DB Overhead Extensions
exercises.cueSummary: Take a dumbbell overhead, bend only at the elbow, and fully extend while the upper arm stays locked in place.

exercises.name: Single Arm Decline Cable Presses
exercises.cueSummary: Single arm cable press targeting lower chest with downward angle.

exercises.name: Single Arm Dumbbell Press (Standing Overhead)
exercises.cueSummary: Unilateral overhead press to identify and fix strength imbalances; press one dumbbell overhead while bracing hard through the core.

exercises.name: Single Arm Farmer Carries
exercises.cueSummary: One-sided carries to challenge grip and core stability; brutal for forearm thickness.

exercises.name: Single Arm Hammer Curls
exercises.cueSummary: One arm at a time, neutral grip, strict form hammer curls for brachialis focus.

exercises.name: Single Arm Hammer Curls
exercises.cueSummary: One arm at a time, neutral grip, strict control to load the brachialis.

exercises.name: Single Arm Incline Lateral Raise
exercises.cueSummary: Lean on an incline bench and perform single‑arm laterals to focus entirely on one side delt at a time.

exercises.name: Single Arm Tricep Extensions (DB Overhead)
exercises.cueSummary: Overhead or lying, extend fully and squeeze the back of the arm one side at a time.

exercises.name: Single‑Leg DB RDLs
exercises.cueSummary: Balance on one leg, hinge at the hip while the dumbbell drops toward the floor, then snap back up by driving the hip through.

exercises.name: Sissy Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Hold onto support, push knees far over toes and lean back, lowering under control then driving back up.

exercises.name: Skull Crushers
exercises.cueSummary: Lower the bar behind the head to stretch the long head, extend without flaring elbows.

exercises.name: Sledgehammer Forearm Sequence
exercises.cueSummary: Lever‑based forearm work using a hammer to light up all the small supporting muscles.

exercises.name: Standing Barbell Press
exercises.cueSummary: Stand tall, brace the mid‑section, press the bar overhead while locking ribs down and pushing your body under the bar at the top.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Stand tall, rise onto the balls of your feet, squeeze the calves hard and lower under full control.

exercises.name: Standing Good Mornings
exercises.cueSummary: Bar on your back, soft knees, hinge from the hips under control and stand tall to build rock‑solid erectors.

exercises.name: Standing Reverse Incline Flyes
exercises.cueSummary: Hinge over or use an incline bench, sweep the dumbbells out and back to squeeze mid‑traps and rear delts.

exercises.name: Sumo Deadlift
exercises.cueSummary: Wide stance, toes out, push knees out and drive through the floor keeping the bar close and hips in line with shoulders.

exercises.name: Supermans
exercises.cueSummary: On your stomach, raise arms and legs slightly off the floor, pulling the shoulder blades down and back.

exercises.name: Super Wide Pulldowns
exercises.cueSummary: Take an extra‑wide grip on the pulldown bar and pull to the upper chest to hammer upper lats and teres without swinging.

exercises.name: Supinated Barbell Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Underhand barbell rows pulling toward the lower abs to emphasize lats and teres major.

exercises.name: Supinated Dumbbell Rows
exercises.cueSummary: One‑arm underhand DB rows with a stretch at the bottom and elbow tracking close to the hip.

exercises.name: T-Bar Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Hinge over the T‑bar, pull handle to lower chest/upper abs, squeeze shoulder blades without bouncing.

exercises.name: The Double Dip
exercises.cueSummary: Two-part dip movement for extra lower chest activation.

exercises.name: T Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Prone on a bench, raise arms straight out to a “T” with thumbs up, squeezing shoulder blades together for pure mid‑trap and rear‑delt work.

exercises.name: Triangle Attachment Tricep Superset
exercises.cueSummary: Heavy triangle‑handle pushdowns used as part of a nasty tricep superset.

exercises.name: Triangle Attachment Pushdowns
exercises.cueSummary: Use triangle handle, lean slightly forward, drive down and lock out.

exercises.name: Triple Rear Delt Delight
exercises.cueSummary: Three rear‑delt variations chained together to torch the back of the shoulder.

exercises.name: Turtle Raises
exercises.cueSummary: Think “anti‑slouch” – pull the shoulders back and down while reaching long through the arms.

exercises.name: Uncle Rommy Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Rommy’s signature curl variation to build a nasty pump and fuller biceps.

exercises.name: Uncle Rommy Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Signature curl variation from Uncle Rommy used as a fun finisher for a nasty pump.

exercises.name: Underhand Pulldown
exercises.cueSummary: Supinated‑grip pulldown with elbows tucked, pulling bar to upper chest to load lower lats and teres major.

exercises.name: Upper Back Barbell Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Row higher toward the chest with flared elbows to bias upper‑back thickness over lats.

exercises.name: Upper Back Dumbbell Rows
exercises.cueSummary: Higher‑angle DB rows focused on pulling with the upper back and rear delts rather than the lats.

exercises.name: Upright Dips (Tricep Dips)
exercises.cueSummary: Stay upright, elbows close, focus on pure tricep lockout.

exercises.name: Upright Rows (Straight Bar/EZ Bar)
exercises.cueSummary: Classic barbell or EZ‑bar upright rows – pull elbows high along the body in a comfortable range to blow up traps safely.

exercises.name: Upright Rows (Straight Bar / EZ Bar)
exercises.cueSummary: Pull bar up close to the body with elbows traveling high and out, stopping around lower chest height.

exercises.name: Waiter Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Hold a single dumbbell/plate like a tray, curl up and squeeze for peak and inner head.

exercises.name: Waiter Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Hold a dumbbell or plate under the palms like a tray and curl up to target inner biceps.

exercises.name: Wall Drags
exercises.cueSummary: Back against the wall, forearms sliding up/down while keeping ribs down and shoulder blades glued.

exercises.name: Weighted Dips
exercises.cueSummary: Add weight with belt or dumbbell between legs, lean forward for chest emphasis.

exercises.name: Weighted Dips (Upright)
exercises.cueSummary: Stay more upright and lock out hard to hammer triceps.

exercises.name: Weighted Plate Mobility
exercises.cueSummary: Plate‑loaded mobility flow (around‑the‑worlds, reaches, hinges) to grease the entire posterior chain.

exercises.name: Weighted Pull Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Strap on weight, full hang at the bottom, pull chest to bar while keeping ribs down and lats locked in.

exercises.name: Wide Dumbbell Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Hold dumbbells with a wider grip and curl to emphasize inner/short head.

exercises.name: Wide Dumbbell Curls
exercises.cueSummary: Hands slightly wider and turned out to emphasize the long head of the biceps.

exercises.name: Wide Grip Barbell Curl
exercises.cueSummary: Wider grip on the bar shifts emphasis to inner biceps and creates that thick frontal look.

exercises.name: Wide Grip Hammer Strength Row
exercises.cueSummary: Wide‑grip Hammer Strength rows pulling toward upper torso to hit lats plus upper back without relying on lower‑back cheat.

exercises.name: Wide Grip Pull Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Wide grip on the bar, drive elbows down and in to light up the outer lats and upper back.

exercises.name: Wide Neutral Grip Pull Ups
exercises.cueSummary: Use a wide neutral grip attachment, think “elbows to ribs” to bias lower lats while keeping shoulders happier.

exercises.name: Wide Stance Box Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Take a wide stance, sit back to a box under control, pause lightly then drive up through heels and hips.

exercises.name: Y Raises
exercises.cueSummary: On an incline bench or standing, raise the arms in a “Y” while keeping the ribs down and shoulder blades depressed.

exercises.name: Zercher Deadlifts
exercises.cueSummary: Cradle the bar in your elbows, hinge and squat down to the bar, then stand tall keeping the core braced.

exercises.name: Zercher RDLs
exercises.cueSummary: Hold bar in the elbows like a Zercher squat, push hips back into a hinge while maintaining a strong brace.

exercises.name: Zercher Squats
exercises.cueSummary: Cradle the bar in your elbows, stay upright and sit between your hips with full control before standing tall.

formulas.name: Long Head – Incline DB Curls + Cable Curls
formulas.description: EXAMPLE FOR THE LONG HEAD: Incline Dumbbell Curls (Compound Lift) followed by Cable Curls (isolation exercise).

formulas.name: Short Head – Preacher Curls + Wide Dumbbell Curls
formulas.description: EXAMPLE FOR THE SHORT HEAD: Preacher Curls (Compound/anchored) followed by Wide Dumbbell Curls (isolation).

formulas.name: Brachialis MAXIMALISM – Reverse Dumbbell Curls
formulas.description: EXERCISE EXAMPLE FOR THE BRACHIALIS: Reverse Dumbbell Curls. This simultaneously hits brachialis and brachioradialis, making your arms look THICK and boosting grip strength.

formulas.name: Calves & Achilles – Toe Raises + Standing Calf Raises
formulas.description: Shin work plus heavy standing calf raises to build thick calves and a strong Achilles.

formulas.name: Lower Chest SuperSet
formulas.description: Compound lower chest movement (5-9 reps) supersetted with isolation movement (8-13 reps) for abdominal head.

formulas.name: Middle Chest SuperSet
formulas.description: Compound mid chest movement (5-9 reps) supersetted with isolation movement (8-13 reps) for sternocostal head.

formulas.name: Upper Chest SuperSet
formulas.description: Compound upper chest movement (5-9 reps) supersetted with isolation movement (8-13 reps) to laser-focus stimulus on the clavicular head.

formulas.name: Glute Max – RDL + Barbell Hip Thrusts
formulas.description: Use a heavy hinge followed by a pure glute lockout to light up the whole posterior chain.

formulas.name: Hamstrings – Nordic Curls + Leg Curls
formulas.description: Pair brutal eccentric strength with a pump‑style finisher to hammer both long and short heads.

formulas.name: Knee / VMO / Tibialis – Extensions + Sissy + Toe Raises
formulas.description: A tri‑set to attack the front of the knee from every angle while building tibialis strength.

formulas.name: Lateral Delt SuperSet
formulas.description: Shoulder compound press paired with brutal lateral raise isolation to blow up the mid‑delts.

formulas.name: Lats – Close Grip Pull-Ups + Lat Pull Ins
formulas.description: EXERCISE EXAMPLES FOR THE LATS: Close Grip Pull-Ups (Compound Movement) followed by Lat Pull Ins (Isolation Exercise).

formulas.name: Posterior Deltoid SuperSet
formulas.description: Rear‑delt focused superset: one heavy rear‑delt compound row plus a second rear‑delt isolation to failure.

formulas.name: Rhomboids – T-Bar Rows + Turtle Raises
formulas.description: EXERCISE EXAMPLE FOR THE RHOMBOIDS: T-Bar Rows (compound lift) followed by Turtle Raises (isolation exercise).

formulas.name: Rotator Cuff – Face Pulls + External Rotation + LU Raises
formulas.description: THE 3 EXERCISES FOR COMPLETE ROTATOR CUFF WORK: Face Pulls (Back), Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotations and LU Raises.

formulas.name: Rotator Cuff Tri‑Set
formulas.description: Three‑exercise tri‑set using external rotations, internal rotations and rear‑delt/cuff raises to build a bulletproof cuff.

formulas.name: Overhead Press Strength Drop‑Set Standard
formulas.description: Pick ONE heavy overhead press and run a 3–4RM followed by two ~20% drops where you set rep PRs. Core benchmark for shoulder strength phases.

formulas.name: Lateral Head – Dips + Triangle Attachment Pushdowns
formulas.description: EXAMPLE FOR THE LATERAL HEAD: Dips (Compound Lift) followed by Triangle Attachment Pushdowns (Isolation exercise).

formulas.name: Long Head – Skull Crushers + Single Arm DB Extensions
formulas.description: EXAMPLE FOR THE LONG HEAD: Skull Crushers (Compound Lift) followed by Single Arm DB Extensions (isolation exercise).

formulas.name: Medial Head – Close Grip Bench + Reverse Grip Pushdowns
formulas.description: EXAMPLE FOR THE MEDIAL HEAD: Close Grip Bench (Compound Lift) followed by Reverse Grip Pushdowns (isolation exercise).

formulaSteps.notes: Moderate to high reps with strict form.
Pre‑pump the tibialis with 15–25 controlled reps.
Heavy straight sets in the 8–15 rep range with a pause at stretch and squeeze.
Fail between 5-9 reps

12–20 reps focusing on constant tension and full squeeze.
Controlled 10–15 reps, stay shy of joint pain but chase burn.
Bodyweight or lightly loaded, 8–12 reps through long knee travel.
High‑rep tibialis work to finish the joint from the front.
2–3 sets x 6–10 reps – short ROM, constant tension pressing to load front and side delts.
Immediately into 10–15 reps, slow negative, slight pause at top. Push near or to muscular failure.
Heavy lower‑rep sets to build raw vertical pulling strength.
High tension, stretch + squeeze for pure lat meat.
2–3 sets x 8–12 reps – high‑elbow rows to load rear delts and upper back.
Immediately into 12–20 reps for a deep rear‑delt burn. Use strict form, tiny ROM, and constant tension.
Heavy sets in the 5–9 rep zone, focus on scap retraction.

High‑rep, clean form; think rear delts and scapular control.

2–3 sets x 12–20 reps per side, strict form and smooth rotation.
2–3 sets x 12–20 reps per side, stepping out just enough to keep constant tension.
2–3 sets x 12–20 reps per side to hit the internal rotators and balance the cuff.
Set 1: Work up to a true 3–4 rep max (heavy but technically clean).
Set 2: Drop the load ~20%, hit as many clean reps as possible, set a rep PR.
Set 3: Drop another ~20%, again go for a rep PR. Track these over time.
Heavy but controlled sets with deep stretch.
Chase a nasty pump in the long head, moderate-to-high reps.

workouts.name: THE SNIPER’S ARM DAY (THE ARM DAY FORMULA)
workouts.goal: Arm strength and hypertrophy focused on the muscle you prioritize first.
workouts.priorityRules: READ: The muscle you want to PRIORITIZE (the one you care about more) is the one to START off with. You can start with Triceps or Biceps (but my recommendation is Triceps).

workouts.name: THE SNIPER’S BACK DAY (THE BACK DAY FORMULA)
workouts.goal: Back strength and hypertrophy across lats, upper back, erectors and shoulder‑stability system.
workouts.priorityRules: READ: The muscle or weakness you want to prioritize is what you start the session with (usually heavy vertical pulling).

workouts.name: THE SNIPER'S CHEST DAY (THE CHEST DAY FORMULA)
workouts.goal: Complete chest development targeting all 3 heads of the pectoralis major plus foundation work for pec minor.
workouts.priorityRules: Start with STRENGTH block using upper chest movements (Upper Chest Supremacist approach), then work through all heads with supersets.

workouts.name: THE SNIPER’S LEG DAY (THE LEG DAY FORMULA)
workouts.goal: Leg strength and hypertrophy focused on building a complete lower body – glutes, hams, quads and calves.
workouts.priorityRules: Start with ONE heavy strength movement for legs (squat or hinge) using the 3‑set drop‑set scheme. Then follow the blocks in order: posterior chain, single‑leg quad, hamstring superset, knee/tibialis work and finishers. Choose from the listed options but keep the structure the same so the formula stays deadly and repeatable.

workouts.name: THE SNIPER’S SHOULDER DAY (THE SHOULDER DAY FORMULA)
workouts.goal: 3D shoulder hypertrophy and pressing strength while building a resilient cuff and upper‑back support system.
workouts.priorityRules: The weakness you want to fix (pressing strength, rear delts, side delts or shoulder pain) determines which block gets your freshest effort.

workoutBlocks.label: 1. Triceps – NUMBER 1 Strength (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc:
Set 1: 3–4 Rep Max
Set 2: Drop 20% & set REP PR
Set 3: Drop another 20% & set REP PR
Explanation: Work up to a 3–4 Rep Max for 1 set. Take a 3–4 minute break. Then drop the weight by 20% and set a REP PR. Take another 3–4 minute break. Then drop the weight by another 20% and set another REP PR.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE of these pressing variations and follow the drop-set scheme.

workoutBlocks.label: 2. Biceps – NUMBER 1 Strength (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 3 sets failing between 4–7 reps.
workoutBlocks.notes: Heavy curls in a low-ish rep range to build bicep strength.

workoutBlocks.label: 3. Long Head Tricep SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Compound movement: fail between 5–9 reps (pick 1), then superset isolation: fail between 7–11 reps (pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE compound (Skull Crushers or JM Press) and ONE isolation (Single Arm DB Extensions / DB JM Press / DB Lying Extensions).

workoutBlocks.label: 4. Long Head Bicep SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Compound movement: fail between 5–9 reps (pick 1), then superset isolation: fail between 7–11 reps (pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE compound (Incline DB Curl or Cable Curl) and ONE isolation (Drag Curls or Close Grip Bar Curl).

workoutBlocks.label: 5. Tricep SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets x failure between 6–9 reps both ways using attachment supersets.
workoutBlocks.notes: Triangle Attachment Tricep Superset + Rope Attachment Tricep Superset.

workoutBlocks.label: 6. Bicep SuperSet (Brachialis Focus)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Brachialis-oriented movement: fail between 6–9 reps (pick 1), then superset movement: fail between 6–9 reps (pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE hammer/reverse variant, then ONE reverse curl variant to torch brachialis and brachioradialis.

workoutBlocks.label: 7. OPTIONAL: Arm Superset (Bicep & Tricep)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Tricep: fail between 7–11 reps (pick 1). Bicep: fail between 6–9 reps (pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes:
Tricep options: Criss Cross Cable Pushdowns, Hammer Strength Tricep Extensions, Upright Dips.
Bicep options: Preacher Bar Curls, Waiter Curls, Wide Dumbbell Curls, Wide Grip Barbell Curl, Uncle Rommy Curls.

workoutBlocks.label: 8. FOREARMS
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: DUMBBELL Forearm Circuit + Sledgehammer Forearm Sequence. Optionally add Dead Hangs and Farmer Carries as accessories.
workoutBlocks.notes: These sequences blow up grip strength and forearm size while supporting all your pressing and pulling.

workoutBlocks.label: 1. Strength – NUMBER 1 Back Movement (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc:
Set 1: 3–4 Rep Max
Set 2: Drop ~20% & set REP PR
Set 3: Drop another ~20% & set REP PR
Work up to a heavy 3–4 rep max, then run two back‑off drops as rep PRs.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE heavy vertical pull (weighted pull‑up or pulldown variation) and run the drop‑set strength scheme.

workoutBlocks.label: 2. Horizontal Pulling Back SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Compound row (fail 5–9 reps) paired with second heavy back movement (fail 5–9 reps).
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick two heavy rowing options. One can be more lat‑biased (supinated/neutral) and one more upper‑back‑biased (high‑elbow).

workoutBlocks.label: 3. Back (Lat) SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Compound vertical pull (5–9 reps) immediately into lat isolation (7–11 reps).
workoutBlocks.notes: Think vertical lat overload followed by a lat isolation movement to leave nothing on the table.

workoutBlocks.label: 4. Upper Back SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Heavy upper‑back row (5–9 reps) plus rear‑delt/upper‑trap isolation (10–15 reps).
workoutBlocks.notes: Use this to blow up mid/lower traps, rhomboids and rear delts for that armor‑plated upper back.

workoutBlocks.label: 5. Lower Back / Erector Spinae Exercise
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets of hinges/extensions, usually in the 6–10 rep range.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE: deadlifts, rack pulls, hyperextension rows or good‑morning variants to build spinal armor.

workoutBlocks.label: 6. Injury Resilience – Upper Back / Neck / Trap
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets of 10–20 reps for resilience movements like shrugs, bridges and neck work.
workoutBlocks.notes: Think long game: build the scaffolding around the neck and upper back so heavy training feels sustainable.

workoutBlocks.label: 7. Mobility – Back
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: Pick 1–3 drills and perform 1–2 rounds each after the heavy work: hangs, wall drags, PVC work, overhead holds.
workoutBlocks.notes: Use this to keep shoulders and thoracic spine from locking up as you push heavier strength blocks.

workoutBlocks.label: 8. Shoulder Rehab Sequence
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: Dead Hangs → Shoulder Elixir Potion → Face Pulls (Back) → Cable External Rotations → Cable Internal Rotations.
workoutBlocks.notes: Run this as prescribed in the rehab section when your shoulders are pissed or as a weekly prehab circuit.

workoutBlocks.label: 1. Strength – NUMBER 1 Shoulder Movement (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc:
Set 1: 3–4 Rep Max
Set 2: Drop ~20% & set REP PR
Set 3: Drop another ~20% & set REP PR
Use one heavy overhead press as your benchmark strength lift.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE overhead press and ride it for a mesocycle. Focus on clean, explosive reps and logbook progression.

workoutBlocks.label: 2. Posterior Deltoid SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Heavy rear‑delt row immediately into a smaller rear‑delt isolation. Aim for AMRAP within a hard but controlled rep range.
workoutBlocks.notes: Use this to finally treat rear delts like the main event instead of a throw‑away finisher.

workoutBlocks.label: 3. Lateral Delt SuperSet
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 sets. Compound shoulder movement (6–10 reps) into lateral raise isolation (7–12+ reps).
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick one press/compound and one lateral variant. Push both near failure to inflate the mid delts.

workoutBlocks.label: 4. Front Delt & Trap Finisher
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 1–3 rounds of 2–4 movements chained together (front raises, upright rows, intensity techniques).
workoutBlocks.notes: Use 21’s, mid‑delt drop sets, front raises and upright row variants here. This is where you empty the tank without wrecking your joints.

workoutBlocks.label: 5. OPTIONAL – Shoulder Elixir / Rehab Block
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 circuits of cuff and mobility work using hangs, rotations and face pulls.
workoutBlocks.notes: Run this if your shoulders are cranky, or as prehab during heavy pressing cycles.

workoutBlocks.label: 1. Strength – NUMBER 1 Leg Movement (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc:
Set 1: 3–4 Rep Max
Set 2: Drop ~20% & set REP PR
Set 3: Drop another ~20% & set REP PR
Work up to a heavy 3–4 rep max, then run two back‑off drops as rep PRs.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE heavy squat/hinge and run the full drop‑set scheme before anything else.

workoutBlocks.label: 2. Posterior Chain – Hip Hinge & Glute Power
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–4 heavy sets of 6–10 reps, then optional lighter back‑off sets for pump.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick 1–2 of these posterior‑chain movements and focus on controlled, powerful reps.

workoutBlocks.label: 3. Single‑Leg Quad Exercise (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 3 sets per leg, failing between 8–12 reps.
workoutBlocks.notes: Use one of these to hammer each leg individually and expose left/right imbalances.

workoutBlocks.label: 4. Hamstring SUPERSET
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 supersets. First movement: heavy 8–12 reps. Second movement: high‑rep / near‑failure pump.
workoutBlocks.notes: Think one heavy hinge or curl, immediately into a pump finisher (bridge, curl, or reverse hyper).

workoutBlocks.label: 5. Knee / VMO / Tibialis Block
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 2–3 rounds of a tri‑set: Leg Extensions → Sissy Squats → Tibialis/Calf work.
workoutBlocks.notes: Use this block to bulletproof knees and shins with controlled long‑range work.

workoutBlocks.label: 6. Injury Resilience / Finisher
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: Pick 2–4 movements and run them as a circuit for high‑rep sets to finish hips, groin and calves.
workoutBlocks.notes: Side‑lying leg work, Copenhagen’s and calf work here make your legs feel “bulletproofed” instead of just pumped.

workoutBlocks.label: 1. Strength (Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc:
Set 1: 3-4 Rep Max
Set 2: Drop 20% & Set REP PR
Set 3: Drop another 20% & Set REP PR
Explanation: Work up to a 3-4 Rep Max for 1 set. Take a 3-4 minute break. Then drop the weight by 20% and set a REP PR. Take another 3-4 minute break. Then drop the weight by another 20% and set another REP PR.
workoutBlocks.notes: Pick ONE of these pressing variations. Upper chest focused for the Upper Chest Supremacist approach.

workoutBlocks.label: 2. Upper Chest SuperSet (2-3 Sets)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 1st Chest Movement: Fail between 5-9 Reps (Pick 1), then superset 2nd Chest Movement: Fail between 8-13 Reps (Pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes: Compound options: Incline Barbell/Dumbbell Bench, Incline Hammer Strength, Reverse Grip Bench. Isolation options: Feet Elevated Push-Ups, Cable Upper Chest Flyes, Landmine Press.

workoutBlocks.label: 3. Middle Chest SuperSet (2-3 Sets)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 1st Chest Movement: Fail between 5-9 Reps (Pick 1), then superset 2nd Chest Movement: Fail between 8-13 Reps (Pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes: Compound options: Flat Barbell/Dumbbell Bench, Hammer Strength, Reverse Grip/Floor Press (if rotator cuff pain). Isolation options: Push-Ups, Flat Cable Flyes, Pec Dec Flyes, Pullovers, Floor Flyes.

workoutBlocks.label: 4. Lower Chest SuperSet (2-3 Sets)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: 1st Chest Movement: Fail between 5-9 Reps (Pick 1), then superset 2nd Chest Movement: Fail between 8-13 Reps (Pick 1).
workoutBlocks.notes: Compound options: Chest Dips, Decline Dumbbell Bench, Banded Decline DB Press, The Double Dip. Isolation options: Flat Plate Push-Ups, Decline Cable Crossovers, Dog Pounds, Single Arm Decline Cable Press.

workoutBlocks.label: 5. Shoulder Mobility (2-3 Sets, Pick 1)
workoutBlocks.schemeDesc: Pullovers: Fail between 8-13 Reps. Or PVC Pipe work in between sets.
workoutBlocks.notes: Maintains shoulder health and adds extra pec minor work. Can be done between sets of other exercises.
